Squashed commits:

[b3aefe4] Android 4.0.4 or BUST.

This marks the point where ICS is a must.

Changed the old reconnect mechanism to a more 'aggressive' one. This keeps the server (and hopefully backlogs) open for those who might prefer active (timed) reconnect versus passive (response-based) or state-based reconnect. It's perfectly possible to put all three options together, and it should safely wait if there is no connection (e.g. the network has gone transient)

Move ColorScheme management into ColorSchemeManager

This does two things: I can now Inherit from ColorScheme and generate
some things, but it also begins to move the ColorScheme to a more abstract
and out-of-the-way idea.

ColorScheme shouldn't have to worry about the preferences changing. Why?
Why should it NEED to? It doesn't, and it shouldn't. This does exactly that,
moving that logic into the ColorSchemeManager.

This also allows me to 'show' the color schemes later on, and possibly
use it for the color variety preview.

Fix a bug making loading themes never happen

_context is null inside loadScheme -- that's bad.

it's 03h05 and I don't want to write a damn commit message

So here it goes:

I fixed things. A lot of things. In a lot of cases, I've fixed bugs that are
important for the current space. For example, AddAliasActivity is now a
LinearLayout and is really a dialog container.

I need to make it a real dialog. Just like Pinnochio needs to be a real boy
and get laid by a real woman not a cheap $5 hooker.

This commit message is nasty. Dear future self: don't write commit
messages at 03h10.

There's some proofing in App.java that makes it less likely to blow up in
your face. There's some cool shit I've mangled in CommandListView
that makes it less likely to blow up in your face.

I've muddled with some strings. Some words got changerized. Indicator
nubs got fiddled with.

Shoot me and the horse I rode in on. Please, deliver me from this.

I've been staring at this code for the last week or so and committing
in batches. This commit message is the final one before I say
'fukkit' and mangle some words, make some words up and add
a tag and release this sonnava to the world.

To whoever reads this commit message: Thank you for getting this far.
You deserve a beer. I need a stiff drink. There's a few other things
I could go for but those requests don't belong in a commit message.

There's some debug slime let over in ConversationActivty. It's mostly the
record of me trying to hunt down something going very bad. This is okay
though, as the failure mode described within that WTF condition is
perfectly valid. If I ever see it in a log anywhere, I'm going to flip doops.

Load this sucker in your mainframe, because it's one ✇ of a mother✇ker.

I'm going to bed. Goodnight world.

Signed-off-by: Morgan Gangwere <morgan.gangwere@gmail.com>
